content: knitted knockers charities increase 1415 e university drive a102 tempe arizona 85288 www knittedknockersusa org knitted knocker one-piece www knittedknockersusa org knitted on double pointed needles in the round knitted knockers are breast prosthesis used by cancer patients after a mastectomy they are knitted in the shape of a breast with cotton yarn acrylic yarns should be avoided when knitted knockers are placed in a bra they take the shape and feel of a real breast to be part of the worldwide knitted knockers charities increase effort knittedknockersusa com all you have to do is make a single knitted knocker then you can either 1 donate the completed knockers to knitted knockers charities increase at 1415 e university drive #a102 tempe arizona 85288 and we will give them to breast cancer survivors free of charge 2 contact one of the regional knitted knockers organizations identified at knittedknockersusa org 3 find someone in your area to donate them to directly you ve just made a difference in women s life if you know someone who needs free knitted knockers have them visit knittedknockersusa com to request a pair ©2022 tempe yarn and fiber / revised 7-19-22 www knittedknockersusa org please share this pattern with anyone wishing to help make knockers knitted knocker one-piece by knittedknockersusa org pattern info with this pattern we have tried to match the needs of the knitters with the needs of the recipients of the knitted knockers with all the varieties of knitting experience levels we understand that this pattern may have parts that are new to you with a little patience and some help from our frequently asked questions and answers at www knittedknockersusa org we are confident you will be able to knit the knockers if however you have questions please email us at info@knittedknockers info pattern question in the subject line and be sure to include a phone number pattern size a b c d dd ddd cup note numbers for size a are given first with the numbers for other sizes in parenthesis if only one number is given it applies to all sizes materials ultra pima by cascade yarns approx 45-105 yards per knocker #3/dk weight yarn 100% cotton 1 set of four us #6/4mm double pointed needles small split ring marker or safety pin sharp tapestry/darning needle gauge 22 sts/24 row = 4 inches in stockinette stitch abbreviations bobble = bind off co = cast on dpn = double pointed needle k = knit kfb = knit in the front and the back of the same stitch k2tog = knit two together sts = stitches ws = wrong side m1l= make one left insert the left needle from front to back under the horizontal strand running between the last st worked on the right needle and the first st on the left needle lifting that strand onto the left needle knit the strand through the back loop to create a new stitch note this increase is preferrable however if using it
